newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: CASH rises 4.55 pct on retail play.
newsitem.headline: CASH rises 4.55 pct on retail play.

text.p: The stock of Malaysia's Construction and Supplies House Bhd (CASH) rose 4.55 percent in active morning trading on continued retail play on timber-linked shares, dealers said.
Around 0220 GMT, the stock was up 18 cents to 4.14 ringgit on volume of 3.85 million.
The stock was also up in Singapore's over-the-counter market, gaining 10 Singapore cents to S$2.39 on the market's most active volume of 3.1 million.
"After NBT, now people are playing CASH as timber-related play," said a retail dealer at Keppel Securities in Singapore.
NBT, or North Borneo Timber, was a top retail play last week, rising with a crop of other timber stocks.
On Monday, NBT stock fell 2.25 ringgit or 6.12 percent to 34.50. NBT said last Thursday it was not aware of any market rumour which has caused recent heavy trading in the stock.
